title: Textractor not identifying pdf format with Tika running
body:
I am running Apache Tika server, when running code below (from the examples) looks like Textractor thinks input is a website rather than pdf file.
It cannot find local file so I have to use  'file://localhost//' +  for it to find it.
Then the result is below:

```
textractor = Textractor(sentences=True)
textractor(filepath)
```

2022-07-27 18:02:14,574 [WARNING] __init__: Some characters could not be decoded, and were replaced with REPLACEMENT CHARACTER.
['%PDF-1.7 %���� 1 0 obj <>/Metadata 199 0 R/ViewerPreferences 200 0 R>> endobj 2 0 obj <> endobj 3 0 obj <>/ExtGState<>/XObject<>/ProcSet[/PDF/Text/ImageB/ImageC/ImageI] >>/Annots[ 17 0 R] /MediaBox[ 0 0 612 792] /Contents 4 0 R/Group<>/Tabs/S/StructParents 0>> endobj 4 0 obj <> stream x��][��ȱ~7���� H����f�r` �o�8�"�����\x03��,�\x1aiBqv����S_u�"�=��%/� ��X����u��\x17M[��e;{���Eۖ�uu3������ ��?�U�?� �m�ֻ���\x0f-.��*o���j����ٿ�>��\x18


when using tika itself:

```
import tika
from tika import parser
parsed = parser.from_file(filepath)
print(parsed["metadata"])
print(parsed["content"])
```

I get the correct values:
{'Author': 'Ban Yan', 'Content-Type': 'application/pdf', 'Creation-Date': '2022-05-02T13:......

Why does Textractor not realize it is a pdf file and uses appropriate method?

title: Update documentation with new demo and diagrams
body:
Make the following documentation updates.

- Add additional diagrams explaining semantic search/workflows
- Update demo.gif to take up less space and add color output formatting

title: Add indexing guide to docs
body: Add an indexing guide page to the documentation.

title: Move quantize config param to Faiss
body: Only Faiss supports vector quantization. The `quantize` parameter should be moved under Faiss configuration. The top level `quantize` parameter should also be read for backwards compatibility.

title: Use single constant for current pickle protocol
body: All pickle.dump calls currently hard code the pickle protocol to version 4. Create a single constant for this so it's easy to change in the future.

title: Embeddings vector batch improvements
body:
This change will streamline the vectors package and make the following improvements:

- Pass transform batch size to vectors model. Currently, the batch size is only used for collecting documents into transform batches. The underlying vector models have their own hard-coded batch sizes covering how data is incrementally processed within a transform batch. These should be consistent. 

- Make pooling encode method consistent with sentence-transformers encode method by adding batch size parameter

- Add encode batch parameter which controls the underlying vector models batch size. For example, in the case of a transformers model, this would be the tensor model batch size.

- Change word vectors model to use batch size parameter when parallel processing mode is enabled. Currently vectors are serialized to file in batches of 1.

title: Add mmap parameter to Faiss
body:
Faiss can optionally mmap indexes and prevent them from being fully loaded into RAM. This has a query response time tradeoff in exchange for a smaller RAM footprint.

This change will add an option to enable mmap reads through configuration as shown below.

```yaml
faiss:
  mmap: true
```

More can be read here: https://github.com/facebookresearch/faiss/wiki/Indexes-that-do-not-fit-in-RAM#loading-a-standard-index-on-disk

title: ambiguous behavior of limit parameter in sql query search
body:
According to my understanding, limit parameter => maximum number of results to be displayed
But in sql query serach, when limit is kept 100 then results are displayed (20+ results) whereas if limit =10 no results display.
If results are present (20+) for that query then txtai should return 10 results when limit =10.

The limit parameter works as expected in text search (no sql query).

Request Body for /batchserach
{
  "queries": [
    "SELECT id, filename, text, score from txtai WHERE similar(' TOXICITY OF HEXANEDIOIC ACID DILITHIUM SALT ') AND project='test'"
  ],
  "limit": 10
}

body: Cloud configuration is missing from the embeddings.save call in application.upsert.

title: Add notebook on running txtai with native code
body: Add notebook on running txtai with native code

title: Lower required version of Pillow library to prevent unnecessary upgrades
body:
#240 added an image hash pipeline and with that tests to validate the image hashes. Pillow v9.0 caused minor variations in the content stored when calling Image.open and a change was made to require Pillow >=9.0.x. This caused tests to fail, so a minor fix was put in to match the hashes with 9.0.x and require that version in setup.py. 

This has caused a nagging issue with all txtai's notebooks requiring a full restart after install, causing a lot of confusion. This can be seen in #255, #257, #268, #270 and #279. There are likely others who just gave up rather than even filing an issue.

Other than matching hashes, there is no reason to require a version of Pillow higher than 7.1.2 (current version in Colab as of date this issue created). A simple change can be made to the test to check for both the hash generated by 7.1.2 and >= 9.0.

title: A nicer way to share your Colab Tutorials/Documentation
body:
Hi,

I'm enjoying the documentation of txtai! I found your progress to be astounding as a 1 man team! (I think?)
Nevertheless, I am the creator of ColabDog here and I wanted to share a useful extension. I found your package to be really interesting but I found that constantly switching between your Colab documentation to be quite difficult and I understand that as a data scientist, we just want to quickly test out new things. Over my weekends, I developed a Chrome extension that allows users to be able to flick between your useful Colabs. I was wondering if you would find something like this useful? I would love to get feedback on this! 

Below is a screenshot. On the right - you can see a list of directories to all the different Colab Notebooks you have. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/108557828/177171848-21746a28-ab5a-4f1a-9c8a-2f65c4a37316.png)

You can install the Chrome Extension [here](https://github.com/ColabDog/colabdog-chrome-extension-releases/releases). 
And once you install the Chrome extension, you can simply click on the link below to see the Playlist!

[Colab Playlist](https://colab.research.google.com/github/neuml/txtai/blob/master/examples/01_Introducing_txtai.ipynb?colabDogPlaylist=%5B%28%27tXle%21%27U+J+%E2%96%B6%EF%B8%8F6*01_U_J8wXh+Huggkg+Face+DTasets6*02KwXh_Huggkg_Face_DTasets8fromOdTa+source6*03Kfrom_a_dTa_source-Add+z+G+to+ElaqicG6*04_Add_z_G_to_ElaqicG-j+G+wXh+images6*13_j_G_wXh_images-V+e7+cluqer6*15_V_e7_cluqer-WhT%22s+new+k+J+4.06*24_WhTs_new_k_J_4_0-AnTomy+ofOJ+R6*29_AnTomy_of_a_J_R-Cuqom+E7+SQL+Z6*30_E7_SQL_cuqom_Z-Model+N6*32_Model_N-Query+Y6*33_Query_Y-POQA+dTabase6*34_P_a_QA_dTabasev%5D*ps%3A%2F%2FgXhub.com%2Fneuml%2FJ%2Fblob%2Fmaqer%2Fexamples%2F-v%2C%28%27tXle%21%276%27%7Eurl%21%27htt7mbeddkgs8-P+an+E7+R+GsearchJtxtaiK_P_an_E7_R_NexplakabilXyO+a+PBuildRkdexTatUIntroduckgVDiqributedXitYtranslTionZfunctionsjSimilarXykinqstv.ipynb%27%29zsemantic%01zvqkjZYXVUTRPONKJG876-*_)

title: Similarity search and filtering documents by user_id inside SQL
body:
Hi David,

I currently have an index with documents that are owned by different users. I want the users to be able to search their documents but to only see the documents that match their user_id. 

When I run this SQL query:
``` SQL
select * from txtai where user_id = 0
```

I am returned this object:
``` JSON
[
	{
		"indexid": 5007,
		"id": "0",
		"text": "This is a test",
		"tags": null,
		"entry": "2022-07-01 18:38:45.665031",
		"data": "{\"text\": \"This is a test\", \"user_id\": 0}",
		"object": null,
		"score": null
	}
]
```

However when I try this query:
``` SQL
select * from txtai where similar('this is test') and user_id = 0
```

I am returned an empty array. Is this the way it is supposed to work? Thanks again :)

title: Add webpage summary image generation notebook
body: Add notebook that generates webpage summary images using DALL-E mini.

title: [Que] : How to save and load trained embeddings  ?
body:
Hello Team,

How to **save and load embeddings?**

step 1 : 

```
# Create embeddings index with content enabled. The default behavior is to only store indexed vectors.
embeddings = Embeddings({"path": "sentence-transformers/nli-mpnet-base-v2", "content": True, "objects": True})

# Create an index for the list of text
embeddings.index([(uid, text, None) for uid, text in enumerate(some_list)])

embeddings.save("/my_embeddings/")

```

Now how to load back embeddings without creating a new embeddings object?

```
ex:
 output = embeddings.search(QUERY, 1)
```

Thanks,

title: Update tabular notebook
body: Update the tabular notebook to add an example workflow with embeddings content set to true.

title: Tabular pipeline throws error when processing list fields
body:
There is a bug in the tabular pipeline when processing list fields. 

```
File "txtai/pipeline/data/tabular.py", line 158, in column
   return None if pd.isnull(value) else value
ValueError: The truth value of an array with more than one element is ambiguous. Use a.any() or a.all()
```

title: Labels pipeline outputs changed with transformers 4.20.0
body:
Unit tests are now failing with transformers 4.20.0. The output of the text-classification pipeline changed when passing a single text element in. Previously, a list of lists was produced, now only a single list with a dict of label outputs is produced.

https://github.com/huggingface/transformers/issues/17754 filed upstream to determine if this change was intentional (need to fix in txtai) or a bug that would be addressed in transformers.

title: Index id sync issue when inserting multiple data types (text, documents, objects) into Embeddings
body:
Currently, the Embeddings index and upsert calls assume all items passed will be loaded into the ANN index.

There is an issue with `content=true` and indexing multiple data types for a single id. For example, there can be document and object elements with additional metadata that is only loaded into a database. For large datasets, this can cause the ANN index id and the database index id to get out of sync.

title: OFFSET in sql query statement
body:
Does the current version support offset?
It will be great if we can do pagination with larger dataset
```
SELECT * from txtai where LIMIT 100 OFFSET 500
```

title: Update pipeline workflow notebook
body: Update the pipeline workflow notebook to show configuration workflows with YAML.

title: Consume generator outputs in workflow tasks
body:
Workflows split data into chunks of data to process and return results as a generator. Workflow tasks are assumed to take a list of inputs and return a list of outputs. Some tasks may return a generator, for example if running another workflow as task.

This change will consume generator outputs and return it as a list. This is acceptable since data was already chunked as part of the workflow. Not doing this results in a processing error as tasks assume outputs are a list.

title: Add ability to resolve workflows within applications
body: Currently, txtai has a WorkflowTask to run another workflow as part of a workflow. Application have no easy way to do this. This change will resolve workflows in the same way pipelines are resolved.

title: Fix breaking change in build script from mkdocstrings
body:
mkdocstrings 0.19 removed the mkdocstrings-python-legacy build dependency. Update the build script to fix this breaking change.

See this issue for more info - https://github.com/mkdocstrings/mkdocstrings/issues/376

title: Enable Inner Join across multiple embedding indexes
body:
Let's say I want to enable semantic search for a SQL database table named product.
The `product` table has columns `id`, `title`, `description` and `color`.
After I create 3 embedding index (`title`, `description` and `color`) with the same unique `id`
Would this be a possible to inner join the query in on inner join statement?
```
SELECT title.text, description.text, color.text, title.score, description.score, color.score
FROM title
INNER JOIN description ON (title.id = description.id)
INNER JOIN color ON (title.id = color.id)
WHERE title.text similar('shirt') OR description.text similar('winkle free') OR color.text similar('blue')
```

title: the key should be writable instead of path
body: Seems like a copy and paste error. Found this typo during installation

title: Unexpected behavior from .index() method
body:
Hey David. I hope I am not posting here too much. I am almost done with my entire application, can't wait to show you.

Basically, I have a dict object "documents" that looks like this:
```
{ 
'filename': str
'chunks': [str]
}
```

After, I pass a list of these documents dictionaries to this method:
``` python
    def custom_index(self, documents: List[Dict]):

        uid = 0
        
        for i, doc in enumerate(documents):
            for chunk in doc['chunks']:
                embeddings.index([(uid, {"URL": doc["filename"], "text": chunk}, None)])
                print(uid)
                uid += 1
        
        embeddings.save(self.index_name)

        return True
```

The reason I am doing this is that the document dictionary represents a single website. The "chunks" are pre-processed text and are pieces of the website's content. This way I can search for specific sections of a website, but when I get back a "chunk" I can see what URL it belongs to.

 The issue I am facing is that after running this method, it appears there is only one element that exists in the index. It seems that with each loop, it is erasing the existing index and replacing it with a single object every time.

title: Dependency issue with ONNX and Protobuf
body:
The latest version of protobuf appears to conflict with onnxruntime. Looks like an upstream issue.

```
   File "/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.13/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/onnx/__init__.py", line 11, in <module>
    from onnx.external_data_helper import load_external_data_for_model, write_external_data_tensors, convert_model_to_external_data
  File "/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.13/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/onnx/external_data_helper.py", line 14, in <module>
    from .onnx_pb import TensorProto, ModelProto
  File "/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.13/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/onnx/onnx_pb.py", line 8, in <module>
    from .onnx_ml_pb2 import *  # noqa
  File "/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.13/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/onnx/onnx_ml_pb2.py", line 37, in <module>
    create_key=_descriptor._internal_create_key),
  File "/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.13/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/google/protobuf/descriptor.py", line 755, in __new__
    _message.Message._CheckCalledFromGeneratedFile()
TypeError: Descriptors cannot not be created directly.
If this call came from a _pb2.py file, your generated code is out of date and must be regenerated with protoc >= 3.19.0.
If you cannot immediately regenerate your protos, some other possible workarounds are:
 1. Downgrade the protobuf package to 3.20.x or lower.
 2. Set PROTOCOL_BUFFERS_PYTHON_IMPLEMENTATION=python (but this will use pure-Python parsing and will be much slower).
 ```

title: deploying API with docker on AWS
body:
Hello,

I am currently attempting to run this dockerfile on an EC2 instance on amazon AWS. The instance being used has a lot of CPU and RAM.

``` dockerfile
FROM neuml/txtai-cpu

# Copy configuration
COPY config.yml .

RUN python -c "from txtai.api import API; API('config.yml', False)"

# Start server and listen on all interfaces
ENV CONFIG "config.yml"
ENTRYPOINT ["uvicorn", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "80", "txtai.api:app"]

EXPOSE 80
```

I have to use `EXPOSE 80` because I using amazon EBS.

When reading the logs, I can see the app is running:
``` bash
INFO:     Application startup complete.

2022-05-26 06:36:46,997 [INFO] startup: Application startup complete.

INFO:     Uvicorn running on http://0.0.0.0:80 (Press CTRL+C to quit)

2022-05-26 06:36:47,001 [INFO] _log_started_message: Uvicorn running on http://0.0.0.0:80 (Press CTRL+C to quit)
```

When I try to access the service at localhost:80/docs or localhost:8000/docs I receive this error:
```
No supported WebSocket library detected. Please use 'pip install uvicorn[standard]', or install 'websockets' or 'wsproto' manually.
```

I don't know how to view the original txtai-cpu image, otherwise, I'd try to modify that logic. Am I making a mistake or is this something related to the dockerfile?

Of course, I would also like to know if this binding issue is only handled by maintainers or if it is something open to the community.

title: add multi-label clasification

title: Add transform workflow action to application
body: Currently, the embeddings index, upsert and search methods can be accessed as workflow actions in Applications. This change will add the embeddings transform workflow action.

title: External vectors
body:
First of all, thank you for adding this feature! 

I am attempting to recreate the example locally from the docs:
``` python
import numpy as np
import requests
from txtai.embeddings import Embeddings

data = ['test', 'test2']
def transform(inputs):
  response = requests.post("https://api-inference.huggingface.co/pipeline/feature-extraction/sentence-transformers/nli-mpnet-base-v2",
                           json={"inputs": inputs})

  return np.array(response.json(), dtype=np.float32)

# Index data using vectors from Inference API
embeddings = Embeddings({"method": "external", "transform": transform, "content": True})
embeddings.index([(uid, text, None) for uid, text in enumerate(data)])

print("%-20s %s" % ("Query", "Best Match"))
print("-" * 50)

print(embeddings.search('test', 1))
```

when I run the search, I receive an empty array. Perhaps data must be a tuple?

title: Fix summary pipeline issue with transformers>=4.19.0
body: transformers 4.19.0 introduced a new validation check on minlength for the summary pipeline. Logic needs to be added that detects when maxlength is set and minlength is not set or minlength > maxlength.

title: Add logic to detect external vectors method
body:
Currently, there is derivation logic to determine if `words` or `transformers` vectors should be used when the `method` config parameter is not provided. This logic should be extended to determine if `external` vectors should be used.

The `method` should be set to `external` when there is no `path` set and there is a `transform` function set.

title: Refactor vectors package to improve code reuse
body: Currently, the vectors package has three methods: external, transformers and word vectors. There is duplicate code within these methods and the code should be refactored.

title: Improve efficiency of external vectors
body:
Currently, the external vectors method takes a transform function that works on a single document. This interface should be changed to encode vectors in batches, similar to how sentence-transformers and word vectors work.

Update corresponding tests, documentation and notebook.s

title: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'transformers.hf_api'
body:
I feel like I'm going crazy, but on two seperate distros (Xubuntu 22.04 and now PopOS 22.04) I'm running into an issue that I didn't have before reinstalling today.

If I install via `pip install txtai[all]` or `[pipeline]`, after having gotten the latest version installed, it downgrades my version. When txtai is downgraded to 3.5.0, I run into this error:
```
    from txtai.embeddings import Embeddings
  File "/home/pathos/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/txtai/embeddings/__init__.py", line 5, in <module>
    from .base import Embeddings
  File "/home/pathos/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/txtai/embeddings/base.py", line 12, in <module>
    from ..scoring import ScoringFactory
  File "/home/pathos/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/txtai/scoring/__init__.py", line 5, in <module>
    from .base import Scoring
  File "/home/pathos/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/txtai/scoring/base.py", line 10, in <module>
    from ..pipeline.tokenizer import Tokenizer
  File "/home/pathos/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/txtai/pipeline/__init__.py", line 20, in <module>
    from .translation import Translation
  File "/home/pathos/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/txtai/pipeline/translation.py", line 15, in <module>
    from transformers.hf_api import HfApi
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'transformers.hf_api'
```
And if I don't install this, and install the latest version with `pip install git+https://github.com/neuml/txtai` or by `git clone` and `pip install .`, this issue is fixed and I can run most of the txtai. HOWEVER, then when trying to use Textractor, I run into the follow error:
```
ImportError: Textractor pipeline is not available - install "pipeline" extra to enable
```
Which, going back to the beginning, if I install the pipeline extra, 4.5.0 gets uninstalled and 3.5.0 gets installed, and then the first issue crops up that I am unsure how to fix, because reinstalling transformers has done absolutely nothing on both distros now.

Also on the side, before reinstalling because of a bugged install(I tried to update PopOS 21.04 to 22.04 and I think it failed somewhere along the line for some reason, because it was very unstable afterwards and eventually failed entirely this morning.), it was working fantastically and I must say this is an incredible package.
```
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| NVIDIA-SMI 510.68.02    Driver Version: 510.68.02    CUDA Version: 11.6     |
|-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
| GPU  Name        Persistence-M| Bus-Id        Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr. ECC |
| Fan  Temp  Perf  Pwr:Usage/Cap|         Memory-Usage | GPU-Util  Compute M. |
|                               |                      |               MIG M. |
|===============================+======================+======================|
|   0  NVIDIA GeForce ...  Off  | 00000000:2D:00.0  On |                  N/A |
|  0%   53C    P0    55W / 260W |   1259MiB / 11264MiB |      5%      Default |
|                               |                      |                  N/A |
+-------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
```
`Python 3.10.4`

title: Add CITATION file
body: Add a CITATION file to help researchers and others who use txtai cite it.

title: Add QA database example notebook
body: Add an example on building a QA database. This is the concept behind [codequestion](https://github.com/neuml/codequestion)

title: Add scripts to train bashsql query translation model
body: Add scripts to train bashsql query translation model. Reorganize scripts into separate directories for bashsql and txtsql.

I'm using Google Colab and the exact tutorial from this github.

```
from txtai.pipeline import Translation
translate = Translation()
translation = translate("This is a test translation into Spanish", "es")
translation
```

title: Add notebook for query translation
body: Add notebook for query translation

title: Colab example not working
body:
Hi, I tried your notebook at https://colab.research.google.com/github/neuml/txtai/blob/master/examples/10_Extract_text_from_documents.ipynb
but the second cell ("Create a Textractor instance") returns an error:
`RuntimeError: Failed to import transformers.pipelines because of the following error (look up to see its traceback):
module 'PIL.Image' has no attribute 'Resampling'`
Do you have any idea how to fix this?
Great project though!

title: Crossplatform problem running txtai in Windows 10 [WinError 32]
body:
Hello!
First of all, thanks for this amazing project.

I'm getting this error while trying to run some code (which is perfect on a `Macbook Pro mid 2015 - Monterey v12.2`). After creating audio embeddings and trying to save the compressed file I just got the following bug (it saves anyway).

```
  File "C:\Python\lib\shutil.py", line 398, in _rmtree_unsafe
    os.unlink(fullname)
PermissionError: [WinError 32] The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process: 'C:\\Users\\LUISAR~1\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\tmpw_5ft63f\\documents'
```

Now as it worked, I tried to load the embeddings and try to search them, and I get exactly the same error, after getting the first result. So this might seem that some processes are still running even when the library tries to do something else? Or do you think this is a Python problem? 

Thanks in advance

title: Add query translation logic in embeddings searches
body: Add configuration and logic to run query translation models in embeddings searches.

title: Add scripts to train query translation models
body: Add training scripts for building query translation models.

title: grab a object in index by id?
body:
Hello!

Is it possible to retrieve an object by the ID? Something like:
``` python
    def get_by_id(self, id):
        return embeddings.search("select * from txtai where id = " + str(id))
```

thanks

title: API Auth
body: How are folks managing authentication/authorization with their txtai apps?

title: Update HFTrainer to support sequence-sequence models
body: Update HFTrainer pipeline to support training sequence-sequence models.

title: Add sequences pipeline
body: Add a pipeline for running seq2seq aka text2text models. This pipeline will be a more generic version of task specific seq2seq models like translation and summarization.

title: Unit tests failing with transformers==4.18.0
body: CLIP models through sentence_transformers are failing to load. Issue https://github.com/UKPLab/sentence-transformers/issues/1515 has been filed with sentence_transformers to determine where the issue is coming from.

title: Running default.config.yml returns TypeError: register() got an unexpected keyword argument 'ids'
body:
Hi. Checking this project out and excited to get the API running. I set up a docker instance with the official txtai-cpu container and used the default config.yml from the docs to start the process. Here is the config:
``` yml
# Index file path
path: /tmp/index

# Allow indexing of documents
writable: True

# Enbeddings index
embeddings:
  path: sentence-transformers/nli-mpnet-base-v2

# Extractive QA
extractor:
  path: distilbert-base-cased-distilled-squad

# Zero-shot labeling
labels:

# Similarity
similarity:

# Text segmentation
segmentation:
    sentences: true

# Text summarization
summary:

# Text extraction
textractor:
    paragraphs: true
    minlength: 100
    join: true

# Transcribe audio to text
transcription:

# Translate text between languages
translation:

# Workflow definitions
workflow:
    sumfrench:
        tasks:
            - action: textractor
              task: storage
              ids: false
            - action: summary
            - action: translation
              args: ["fr"]
    sumspanish:
        tasks:
            - action: textractor
              task: url
            - action: summary
            - action: translation
              args: ["es"]
```

I attempt to run the service using this command:
``` bash
CONFIG=config.yml uvicorn "txtai.api:app"
```
things appear normal, and models are downloaded from hugginface. After they download I am presented with this error:
``` bash
ERROR:    Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 621, in lifespan
    async with self.lifespan_context(app):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 518, in __aenter__
    await self._router.startup()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 600, in startup
    handler()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/api/application.py", line 67, in start
    INSTANCE = Factory.create(config, api) if api else API(config)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/api/base.py", line 18, in __init__
    super().__init__(config, loaddata)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/app/base.py", line 70, in __init__
    self.flows()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/app/base.py", line 134, in flows
    self.workflows[workflow] = WorkflowFactory.create(config, workflow)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/workflow/factory.py", line 31, in create
    tasks.append(TaskFactory.create(tconfig, task))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/workflow/task/factory.py", line 63, in create
    return TaskFactory.get(task)(**config)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/workflow/task/base.py", line 53, in __init__
    self.register(**kwargs)
TypeError: register() got an unexpected keyword argument 'ids'

2022-04-04 04:21:38,422 [ERROR] send: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 621, in lifespan
    async with self.lifespan_context(app):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 518, in __aenter__
    await self._router.startup()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 600, in startup
    handler()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/api/application.py", line 67, in start
    INSTANCE = Factory.create(config, api) if api else API(config)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/api/base.py", line 18, in __init__
    super().__init__(config, loaddata)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/app/base.py", line 70, in __init__
    self.flows()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/app/base.py", line 134, in flows
    self.workflows[workflow] = WorkflowFactory.create(config, workflow)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/workflow/factory.py", line 31, in create
    tasks.append(TaskFactory.create(tconfig, task))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/workflow/task/factory.py", line 63, in create
    return TaskFactory.get(task)(**config)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/txtai/workflow/task/base.py", line 53, in __init__

TypeError: register() got an unexpected keyword argument 'ids'

ERROR:    Application startup failed. Exiting.
2022-04-04 04:21:38,424 [ERROR] startup: Application startup failed. Exiting.
root@b2e263bd2b88:~/app# 
```

I attempted this after on my local machine and reproduced the same results.

Any thoughts? Thanks!

title: Unit tests failing with tokenizers>= 0.12
body: The entity pipeline is returning results in a different format with tokenizers >= 0.12. Could be possible upstream issue.

title: Add txtai console
body:
Currently there is a simple console program in the examples folder. Make this a full-featured application that is part of txtai with the following features.

- Search
  - Highlight text with explain
  - Limit results
- Run workflows
- Load/reload/show configuration

title: Incremental Indexing
body:
Is it possible to add new data in previously created index files ? E.g. If I have created and saved a Embedding Index file with 5K records and, after some days I have new 2K data which I want to include in my old index file then can I load the old index file and append the new 2K data into it so that when we query in the updated embedding index it will include the new 2K data too ?
OR I need to re-index the whole 7K (old 5k + new 2K) data together ?

title: Video search
body: We can see in readme features that txtai also supports video search but I can not find any related bindings in api or any example for the same. Please show me how txtai works with videos.

title: Add notebook covering model explainability
body: Add notebook covering model explainability

title: Add semantic search explainability
body:
There are a couple of great libraries for model explainability, [SHAP](https://github.com/slundberg/shap) and [Transformers Interpret](https://github.com/cdpierse/transformers-interpret). These libraries primarily focus on explaining classification, question-answering, summarization and translation model outputs. There isn't an easy way to explain the output of embeddings models.

This issue will add explain methods to `embeddings` instances. The implementation will create _n_ permutations for each input text element to determine term importance for query results.

title: Using BM25 and word embeddings throws division by zero error
body:
Hello @davidmezzetti - thanks for a cool package.

I am having some issues using BM25, please see the sample below:

```python
from txtai.embeddings import Embeddings

embeddings = Embeddings({
    "path": "GoogleNews-vectors-negative300.magnitude",
    "scoring": "bm25",
})

embeddings.index(
    [(uid, text, None) for uid, text in enumerate(docs)])
```

Will create the following error:

```

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

---> 96             ids, dimensions, embeddings = transform(documents, buffer)
```

title: Could Tokenize Chinese text in "from txtai.pipeline import Tokenizer", if I want tokenize Chinese text, I must overwrite 'Tokenizer' class?
Fix word embeddings regression with batch transformation
body:
A regression was introduced in the txtai 4.x branch related to the generation of word embeddings vectors.

The embeddings vectors need to be reshaped before being serialized to file.

title: Add notebook for near-duplicate image detection
Add notebook for Embeddings SQL functions
body: Add notebook for Embeddings SQL functions

title: Fix issue with parsing multiline SQL statements
body: Fix issues with whitespace causing the embeddings SQL parser to not detect otherwise valid SQL statements

title: Add support for custom SQL functions in embeddings queries
body:
With the addition of [SQL query support to txtai](https://github.com/neuml/txtai/issues/170), txtai embeddings queries can run with SQL.

This should be extended to support custom user functions (will depend on the database backend). In the case of SQLite, custom Python functions can be registered and called via SQL. This change will enable this functionality in Python and via YAML-configuration.

title: Add Image Hash pipeline
body:
Add a new pipeline that uses the [ImageHash](https://github.com/JohannesBuchner/imagehash) library to build image hashes.

These hashes can be used to detect near-duplicates and similarity but are not based on machine learning models. In other words, it's not designed to detect conceptually similar images. Depending on the task, this may be preferable.

title: How should I use my local model when build an Embeddings instance?
Update transcription pipeline to use AutoModelForCTC
body:
Currently, the transcription pipeline is using the Wav2Vec2ForCTC class to create models. 

This limits the models the pipeline can load. The following new configurations are now available in the latest version of transformers.

- Data2Vec
- Hubert
- SEW
- SEWD
- Unispeech
- UnispeechSat
- WavLM

AutoModelForCTC should be used to support these models.

title: Add notebook covering txtai embeddings index file structure
body: Add notebook covering txtai embeddings index file structure

title: Add last update field to index metadata
body: Add a field `update` each time an ANN index is updated. This will be shown on calls to `embeddings.info()` to help with debugging.

title: API should raise an error if attempting to modify a read-only index
body:
Currently, the API silently skips add/index/upsert/delete operations and returns a HTTP 200 code when an index is not writable. This leads to confusing behavior.

An error should be raised with a 403 Forbidden status code.

title: Ensure limit always set in embeddings search/batchsearch
body: Currently embeddings search/batchsearch default a function parameter for limit = 3. Passing None in for a parameter causes backend errors. This should be fixed to always default if limit=None.

title: Refactor API instance into a separate package
body:
Currently, the API instance is under the api package. This package depends on FastAPI, uvicorn and async HTTP libraries. When starting a local application instance, it is currently creating a blank FastAPI instance and requiring those libraries.

This should be refactored so YAML-configured txtai applications can run without any dependencies.

title: Rename SQLException to SQLError
body: Rename SQLException to SQLError to match Python naming conventions.

title: Fixed mislabeled API config definition
body: The documentation refers to a "cloud" config definition for API YAML. But currently the API is looking for a key of "archive". This change will fix the issue.

title: Add flag to disable loading index data in API
body: Currently, a pattern with the txtai docker images is to RUN an API instance during build. This step will cache transformer models in the image. A flag should be added to skip loading index data so that data isn't cached.

title: Add support for loading/storing embedding indexes on cloud storage
body:
Use Apache Libcloud (already an optional dependency) to support loading and storing embedding indexes on cloud storage.

Apache Libcloud supports these providers: https://libcloud.readthedocs.io/en/stable/supported_providers.html

title: Create docker configuration for AWS Lambda
body:
Create Dockerfile and configuration for running the API and workflows with AWS Lambda.

An additional change in #229 will add support for storing embedding indexes on cloud storage.

title: Label predictions very slow, especially with large (>600) label sets
body:
```
def get_text_classifications(text, ref_labels):
    text_dict={}
    text_dict  = labels(text, ref_labels) 
    return text_dict
```
```
text = "Game of Thrones Season 7: Long Walk Official Promo REACTION ''DISCUSSION!""
ref_labels = [...600+ items long...]
preds = get_text_classifications(text,ref_labels)
pp.pprint(preds)

```
This code takes almost a minute to run, is that expected behavior? How can I improve the performance for zero-shot classification with large label sets? I am running this on a CPU.

```
~ # cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep "model name" 
model name	: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700 CPU @ 3.60GHz
model name	: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700 CPU @ 3.60GHz
model name	: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700 CPU @ 3.60GHz
model name	: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700 CPU @ 3.60GHz
model name	: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700 CPU @ 3.60GHz
model name	: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700 CPU @ 3.60GHz
model name	: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700 CPU @ 3.60GHz
model name	: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700 CPU @ 3.60GHz
```

Thanks so much for a wonderful project. I could give this project multiple stars if I could!

title: Add default and custom docker configurations
body:
Currently, there is a single Dockerfile for a simple API service. This configuration is brittle and old. It should be replaced with a better default image and examples on how to build custom images with model caching.

This issue will add:

- A base Dockerfile for txtai
- Custom Dockerfiles for running an API service, a scheduled workflow service and a one-time workflow
- Upload base txtai images for CPU and GPU runtimes to Docker Hub
- Updated documentation

title: Add notebook for workflow notifications
body: Add notebook for workflow notifications.

title: Check for empty documents input before indexing
body: Currently, if an empty list is passed to `embeddings.index` or `embeddings.upsert`, it is throwing an error as seen in #219. This should be handled more gracefully.

title: Add support for SQL || operator
body: Add support for the `||` concat operator.

title: Embeddings index returning malformed JSON errors in certain situations
body:
When `content` is enabled, certain searches are encountering errors with `Malformed JSON`. The root cause of this is NaN values. The default `json.dumps` method allows NaN, Inf and -Inf values. The strict interpretation of the JSON standard says these are invalid values and SQLite abides by this.

This change should error out before indexing JSON considered invalid by the underlying data store.

title: Modify embeddings search to make return type consistent when index initialized and not initialized
body:
A change went in #214 that ultimately worked around a problem with uninitialized embeddings batch searches (standard searches use the same method and just return the first value). 

Currently, if an embeddings index is not initialized, batch search returns `[]`. This should be instead be `[[]] * len(queries)` as this is what an empty search with an initialized index would produce.

The change in #214 should be rolled back as it just worked around this problem.

title: Modify database decoder methods to check for None
body: Currently, all the decode methods in the module txtai.database.encoder are not checking for None. These methods should be changed to check for None.

title: TypeError when trying to index content data from list of tuples
body:
Hi! I am trying to build an embeddings index with a list of tuples from pandas.DataFrame.itertuples() and I am getting this error. It works when I only provide a flat list of strings but trying to add additional information throws this error. 

I am trying to follow along in the guide like so:
```
# Create an index for the list of text
embeddings.index([(uid, {"text": text, "length": len(text)}, None) for uid, text in enumerate(data)])
``` 

And here is my version:
```
embeddings = Embeddings({"path": "sentence-transformers/all-mpnet-base-v2","backend": "faiss","content": True,"objects":True})

upsert_data = list(df.itertuples())
embeddings.index([(t.Index, { "text":t.text, "first_name":t.first_name, "last_name":t.last_name}, None) for t in upsert_data])
```
TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for *: 'int' and 'NoneType'

title: Add notebook for workflow scheduling
body: Add notebook for workflow scheduling

title: Add lock to API search methods
body: Currently, if an API index or upsert action is running, a parallel search action causes an error. This needs to be fixed.

title: Add Export Task
body: Add a task that exports task outputs to CSV or Excel.
